Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off for Connecting Ipad”
Reviews.Author: William A
Reviews.Content: Overall the property is about what I would expect from an Embassy Suites. Free breakfast, comfortable room, booze in the evening. What I did not expect was that I would be charged $14.95 per device. I was charged $14.95 per day for computer and another $14.95 for my Ipad. I complained to the hotel about the second charge and they said that they would remove it this time. But the manager I spoke with said, "this is the hotel's policy and IT WILL NOT CHANGE. Be forewarned you will be charged for every device.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for what we paid.”
Reviews.Author: UberTravelBum
Reviews.Content: We decided to get out of town and go to Seattle for four days and, using those bidding websites, won this property at a very reasonable $56/night. The hotel itself is not really a SeaTac property; rather, it's located near a large mall ringed by other hotels that is in the vicinity of the old Longacres race track (Renton). This particular hotel has an atrium configuration (rooms face into a large open area), with a large seating/dining area at the base. Overall, the public areas (reception, atrium, pool & exercise room) of the hotel were modern and well maintained; there is an on-site restaurant, but we never used it. As for the rooms, they are large and include a "living room" area (w/couch, chairs, table, bureau), a wet-bar area (w/fridge, sink, microwave, coffee maker), an average bathroom and a separate bedroom w/door (we had two queen beds, large closet, iron & board); flatscreen TVs were located in both the bedroom and living room areas. The room was clean and in a pretty decent shape; there were a few minor things indicating that the room needed minor maintenance (a mirror w/some loose trim, a caster from a rolling bench that was broken, scratches on the bathroom cabinets), but nothing that would prevent me from returning to this property. A few quirks (both positive and negative) to note: 1) Parking is ~$10/night. As this is not really SeaTac (nor downtown) and there is a huge parking lot adjacent to the hotel, this seems a bit tic-tacky for a mandatory "fee." However... 2) The free breakfast is worth ~$10 and is significantly better than the usual "free Continental" sort of deal you typically get. They offer what I would describe as a "Denny's type" breakfast (eggs, omelets, bacon, sausage, pancakes) in addition to breads, fruits, yogurts, cereals and various drinks...all of it included and as much as you want to bust a gut with. We found ourselves eating large breakfasts and then skipping lunch...so the breakfast outweighed the parking penalty in our case. And finally... 3) Free drinks at 5:30! Actually, this is a "Manager's Welcome" sort of deal...whereby you can go to the little bar in the atrium and have a couple of mixed drinks, beer or wine and popcorn or chips & salsa. The first night there, we watched as people just kept going to the bar...I don't think they ever cut anyone off (though the bartender advised us that it was a two-drink limit per guest). Mind you, the social environment remained friendly and not like a frat-house or anything; it was very pleasant. And the booze itself wasn't bad; not top-shelf stuff, but okay...and they offered a passingly decent beer (Sam Adams) on tap. So, what did we learn here? Well...if you get this property at a bidding discount, don't mind the drive downtown for the tourist traps, can justify in your head the parking $$$ tradeoff w/the better-than-average breakfast and free drinks, and don't mind the mall-ambiance of the surrounding area, then this might just be the hotel for you and your family. We feel like we did pretty well on this one... BTW: I reviewed an Indian restaurant in the vicinity that was AWESOME; as Dr. Steve Brule would say, "Check it out!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeslaf
Reviews.Content: Been here several times on the way in/out of Seattle. Great location near mall and 405/I-5. Helpful front desk staff, and hot breakfast with custom, made-to-order omelettes. Love that, as well as the free cocktails during manager's evening reception. The snacks in the evening are bare bones (popcorn, chips/dip) but free drinks are free drinks--and most places only do wine/beer. This place offers a bit more in liquor and less in food. :) Updated older hotel with standard suite rooms. Shuttle is handy, too. Recommended for your Seattle airport stay. There's a local jogging trail out the back parking lot door that follows a railroad track. Seems well-traveled, though I wouldn't go alone. :)

Reviews.Title: “Day stay”
Reviews.Author: Brandon H
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not I only stayed here for about 7 hours. I got screwed with an extremely LONG layover and was not about to spend my day at the airport. I booked a room at a hotel that had a shuttle service and Embassy's have always been reliable. Shuttle driver was prompt and a great guy. Check-in was smooth, fast, the two gals working were great. The hotel itself is an older embassy( i used to work at Embassy Suites La Vista Nebraska) so I find it easy to see the difference. Old none the less the hotel was clean, great decor, rooms were updated and perfect. I had just enough time to go to the managers reception before I left and the two working were such a treat. I checked out later that day, the front desk seemed a little confused that I checked in and checked out the same day but I explained it to them. Probably thought I was crazy but oh well. Wish I could have stayed longer, will plan on it next time that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Twoodr
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here 2 nights over President's weekend. The property was very nice except from the noise that lots of young kids generated due to the atrium style where every sound gets ecoed thoughout the hotel. We didn't even try to use the pool or spa since it was filled with kids. The room had a large living room and dinning table along with 32 inch flat screen TV, mico, fridge and wet bar. Once you are in the bedroom you can shut out the sound and can keep it dark if you want. Unfortunately, the bed is very soft and so not too comfortable. The manager's reception is just chips and pop corn along with drinks- including alcoholic mixed drinks. The breakfast was good - especially the made to order omlets. I found all levels of staff to be friendly and responsive. It is very close to South Center Mall and dozens of other stores and places to eat. We only heard the train once and parking was okay- although I agree they should not charge $10 a night since it is just an open lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: flata
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a budget minded family on an overnight stay in Seattle. My family of 5 stayed here as a stopover on our way to Houston. The hotel staff were friendly and our suite was big enough for our whole family with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. This hotel features an excellent hot buffet breakfast and a nightly managers reception which was on for 2 hours. On the breakfast alone, this is great value for a family of 5. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SDBeachbum
Reviews.Content: Here for a cheer competition. The hotel was filled with cheerleaders, competitive swimmers and volleyball players. It was fun for us, but I could see how a crowd like this might be a major annoyance for business people or those not wanting to be around a bunch of high-schoolers. Went to the business center to use the computers and there was a problem with the printers. I called the tech support number and worked with off-site tech support to correct the problems. As a reward, the staff comped my parking and use of WIFI during my stay. (These items should really be free in the first place.) Full breakfast was great with MANY selections. The only missing item is make-your-own waffles. Convenient to the freeways and lots of nearby restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for travelling family”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_Nanaimo_BC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a flight layover returning from vacation. Very convenient and accommodating for a large family of 6. Shuttled us to and from the hotel to the airport happily and fed us to the brim in the morning...nice job Embassy! Kids were happy....hence, parents are happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJD_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night following an Alaska cruise and found the hotel to be a pretty easy going airport hotel, with reasonably good access to the airport as well as good access to the monorail. Like most airport hotels, the hotel is pretty much in the middle of nowhere. However, they are pretty generous with their courtesy shuttle and will take you, with the free shuttle, to the monorail station from which you can get very easily to downtown Seattle. We also used the courtesy shuttle to go to a shopping area that had several decent chain restaurants (e.g., Cheesecake factory) as well as a pretty good Thai restaurant. Another pleasant surprise: our room had an exercise bike right in the room and the room itself was larger than typical Embassy suites rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charging for parking now!!!”
Reviews.Author: MPS3AMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so handy for us to use. However, I will more than likely look for another hotel (and ther are several in this area) next time we are here.. Most of the hotel has been updated except where you eat. That definately needs it. We were shocked that this hotel is now taking on the attitude of the airlines and charging for everying. I am used to paying for parking in downtown locations; ie Seattle, DC, etc. However Tukwila, Washington ??? We complained and received 2 nights waived out of 4. The other major complaint is the heat in the room. We could not turn it down enough and were forced to open windows, thus listening to the train noise from 100 yards away for 4 nights. Our toilet did not flush properly, so my husband, the plumber lifted the lid to find a washrag in there??? They fixed this immediately and I thank them. This hotel is loosing its spark.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bob l
Reviews.Content: was going to give a 5, but realized they charged both internet and parking, in which i thought it was unnecessary. overall the stay was very nice, great value, courteous staff, great breakfast in the morning, location was decent. we stayed for 3 nights, even did the laundry in the hotel. i saw another guest who mentioned he took the wifi from another hotel, unfortunately, i was not able to do that. pleasant, family oriented, would definitely suggest people to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: waiomaogirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with my husband at the end of December (Wed and Thurs). We checked in around 10:30pm without any issues. It was quick and easy. They did tell us that parking would be $10/day and internet was $9.95 or $14.95 depending on which speed you wanted. We were assigned a room on the third floor, king bed, non smoking. Our room was great. There is a living room with couch, desk, and TV that is separated from the bedroom and bathroom. There is a little sink area outside of the bathroom with mini fridge and microwave. The bedroom was a little small. The bed took up most of the space, but it was fine. The bathroom was average in size and came with crabtree & evelyn shampoo/conditioner/soap/body wash. Do keep in mind that there is a train nearby in the area and you will hear it periodically throughout your stay. You will also hear noise in the atrium if you are in the living room area. We couldn't hear the atrium from the bedroom. This seems to be the hotel of choice for high school and college teams. There were a bunch of teenagers gathering in the lobby and atrium area at night talking and having fun. Breakfast during the weekdays is from 6-9am. I don't know why breakfast ends so early on the weekdays. On the weekends, breakfast is served from 7-10am. We had breakfast on one day and it was really good. There was a line for the hot food, where they take your omelet order. You also get to choose from pancakes, hashbrowns, scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon. There is also the usual stuff like muffins, yogurt, and fresh fruit. It's a really decent breakfast with good selection. There seemed to be enough seating for everyone. If you miss breakfast, there is a bunch of fast food restaurants down the road. I think I saw a Jack in the Box and Taco Bell and a 7-11 store. The hotel is also close to Southcenter Shopping mall, a Target, and Costco. The hotel is right off the 405. We found the hotel's location to be very convenient. Parking spaces are a little cramped and some cars parked crooked or took up 2 spaces. It was a little annoying having to pay extra for parking when there is a lot of parking available. I also think that internet should be complimentary. We got this hotel through priceline for $41/night. It's a great deal and would stay again for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Parking in the alley and borrow WIFI from Courtyard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFromtheWest
Reviews.Content: We love the one bedroom suite. It is spacious and clean. The swimming pool is open 24 hours and we can swim late. The complimentary breakfast is great, although I can foresee problems when there are more people. We park on the side street which divides this hotel from the previous one. So we did not pay $10 a night. There are about 10 spots available. We also borrow Wifi on the side closest to Marriott's free wireless, which are at the swimming pool and the business centre. We will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hospitality”
Reviews.Author: wlkerns
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel and the rooms appear smaller than other Embassy Suites where we have stayed (Bellevue, Nashville, etc). It is convenient to the airport and shuttle service is provided. The free breakfast buffet is the best you will find. The hotel staff-- all of them-- made our visit a very pleasant one. They listened, gave recommendations, and provided services that were beyond the call of duty. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Below average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: TairisNC
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer I was greeted by a less than friendly front desk. It's also absurd to me that a suburban hotel that has a private lot with plenty of parking (self-park only) charges $10 a day for parking. I had to call the front desk both nights of my stay for issues. The first night's issue was taken care of promptly. The atrium configuration makes for a baseline experience that is excessively noisy. The second night the hotel was filled with sports teams who thought it was acceptable to stand in the hallways and atrium until late into the night. The front desk was of no use whatsoever. If you plan on having someone sleep on the sofabed in the living room area of the suite, don't expect a quiet experience at all - especially if there is an event or large party using the property. The free breakfast adds to the value, but there is extremely limited seating in proportion to the size of the hotel and the breakfast area was full of standing, frustrated guests waiting on a seat.

Reviews.Title: “With a few tweaks, could be great”
Reviews.Author: Urdahls
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites for a weekend family get-together, as we had our grown son along with us. When we checked in, I discovered that the in-room coffee hadn't been replenished, and when I called, the front desk immediately sent up a very apologetic housekeeper, but I had to ask a couple of times for enough cups. The Embassy seems to favour the one-cup coffeemakers, which I've always found tetchy to operate, and we were given pods enough for only one cup each, which seems a bit chintzy, though there's plenty in the downstairs breakfast area. The Embassy also charges $10 for parking, which I find to be excessively nickel-and-dime outside of the downtown core. Hallways can be noisy for those sleeping on the hide-a-bed, and my son tossed and turned all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!! Definitely coming back if in the area...”
Reviews.Author: bubbafel
Reviews.Content: Great location, few minutes away from the airport. A lot of restaurants around the area and nearby mall. Free drinks and finger foods during Manager's Special at night and great 'made to order' breakfast! Rooms are spacious and very clean... definitely coming back if I'm in the area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JagDriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property last Saturday night. Check in was efficient, although the front desk clerk seemed to have an attitude - couldn't have been colder. The room was on the sixth floor and was very clean with all the amenities. That night there was a lot of noise in the building which is a result of the atrium architecture; however, the bedroom part of the suite was very quiet. The manager's reception and the cooked to order breakfast were both crowded, but the service and seating were ample. The $10.00 charge for car parking is a bit off putting. The lots are next to the hotel, but the spaces are quite small. Considering the prices of hotels in downtown, this hotel is a good bargain and within thirty minutes of downstown Seattle and downtown Bellevue. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very happy with the stay.”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent value. Its 10 min away airport but they do have 24 hr shuttle. Also, they have complementary shuttle to nearby mall. The hotel is 30min away from downtown, overall traffic in Seattle is very smooth so it wasn't a big deal for us. The rooms are clean. The service is 10/10. There breakfast is excellent. This will be my no.1 choice if I visit seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted Closer to the Airport, but This was Nice”
Reviews.Author: ragazza000
Reviews.Content: This "airport" hotel was still a 10-15 minutes drive to SEATAC, and I still had to turn in a rental car. That made for an early departure (before the nice breakfast) to catch a 0715 flight. The nearby Westfield Mall was a nice way to kill a few extra hours, with several nice restaurants and food court to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy.”
Reviews.Author: Chiefm198
Reviews.Content: My first complaint may not bother everyone. I like my room to get very cold. I'm an insomniac, and cannot sleep at all in a hot room with no air movement. The windows open about 4" on either side, but the drapes cover up that area of the window, so I'm unsure why they open at all. My next complaint I'm sure would bother anyone. After checking out I discovered a used plate, fork and knife had been thrown on the hood of my car, along with other garbage. One of the reasons I choose to stay in an expensive hotel is that I believe my car will be safer there. Next time I'm in the area I'll be staying at cheap hotel with an actual functioning air conditioner and know that my car is just as safe there as at the Seatac Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent service during our stay.”
Reviews.Author: flamingo15
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late so we missed the manager's reception. Staff at the front desk were very friendly and courteous, providing compliment WIFI as our daughter-in-law still had some work to complete. The suite was large and clean. We did not experience any problems at the breakfast service and enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. This hotel is an excellent value and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisman48
Reviews.Content: Great room, great service, for the most part. The shuttle service to and from the airport, or wherever else you might want to go within a five mile radius, is really nice (I used it quite a bit to go to and from the light rail; it was wonderful) My three complaints are that the food at the breakfast buffet tastes really yucky, that the coffee is horrendous (isn't Seattle supposed to have some of the finest coffee anywhere? you wouldn't know it from the muddy coffee at this place), and the rooms are cold (no matter how high you set the thermostat, the system is clearly set so you will never get much heat, because the hotel management doesn't want to have to pay for it). I'd stay here again, though, just for the shuttle service, to be honest. You save a fortune by not having to take a taxi to the city, and taking the light rail instead (only costs $2.75)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if not a busy weekend”
Reviews.Author: TNoble7734
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for 6 days starting August 31. The hotel was quiet and the shuttle service was great for people like me who used the Light Rail to get downtown. There was a nice selection for breakfast, but they had 1 toaster for the entire breakfast crowd and the one side didn't work well. During the weekend it got crowded - there was a youth soccer tournament happening near by. The staff tried their best to accommodate the breakfast crowd, but people still waited online for at least 30 minutes for the buffet food. The omelet line took a lot longer. There were very few plates and utensils and there were too many people confined in a small area. I almost walked out b/c it was so difficult to get around, nevermind find a seat. I saw quite a few people grab what food/drink they could and go back to their room. My room was on the 6th floor and was quiet except when the soccer kids were running past my door or yelling to the balconies below. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. Greg, the shuttle driver, gave us great tips and restaurant recommendations. The managers reception was a nice touch. Overall the stay was good, but the chaos at breakfast would make me think twice about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay except that breakfast was chaotic”
Reviews.Author: WindyRuth
Reviews.Content: Let it be known that I am a big fan of Embassy Suites hotels. When I traveled to Seattle for business, I decided to try out this property because my experience across at a hotel across the street had not been so good two weeks prior. It happened to be the Sunday night of Labor Day Weekend when I checked in so the hotel was extra crowded. The front desk staff were well trained and went above and beyond the call of duty for two guests in front of me and also for me. Because I did my homework and read the Trip Advisor review by another guest, I brought earplugs so that when the train rumbled in the "backyard", I couldn't hear it. The building vibrated every time a train went by but it was like having a free magic fingers bed. Speaking of the bed, it was incredibly comfortable; the room had all the accoutrements that you'd expect at an Embassy Suites property. The only two areas in which the hotel could improve are listed below: 1. More luggage carts. I had to print off several pages of legal documents so I took my printer with me on this trip. It was convenient to have the luggage cart on Sunday night. On Monday morning at 9:30, there were none to be found. I was told there were only five. I had to make three trips to my car. While I didn't mind the exercise, it made me late for my next appointment even though I allowed plenty of time. 2. Have extra staff work breakfast on a holiday morning. I went down for breakfast at 8:00 a.m. and there was still two hours of breakfast service remaining--until 10 a.m. There were no plates, no utensils, no trays, no coffee--regular or decaf, no juice (but the Coke dispenser was working). They had run out of food in the regular tray line. There were so many people looking for all of the above that one could hardly move. I don't think I've ever been to any hotel where there were more people in the breakfast area. I was really disappointed and it took me an hour to get my food. The line was 30 minutes long to get a made-to-order breakfast. One guest asked the kitchen employee if there was any more coffee and she yelled at her and said that she was too busy this morning. Apparently, she was stressed out and needed some help in the kitchen. My guess is that when the vacancy rate is higher, this would be a calmer environment on a normal morning. I would stay here again despite those two concerns because I had one of the best sleeps ever and that's the reason, after all, that one stays in a motel: to get a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good place/value”
Reviews.Author: klk101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy suites for 4 days, it was slightly dated, but overall good. The full breakest was excellant, with plenty to eat (made to order omlets or eggs, bacon, hash browns, pancakes, etc). The only complaint was after breakfast or after the happy hour manager special, the floor of the dining area was extremely messy with popcorn/snacks dropped on the floor. The same mess was there the following day before breakfast. The rooms were clean. The shuttle service was nice, however airport shuttle service takes priority and there were times you may have to wait 20 minutes. The drivers were very pleasant and helpful. the front desk was pleasant most of the time giving google directions if needed. There is nothing open as far as nightclubs after 10:00 that is walkable. The train station if fairly close but not walkable. You can take the shuttle to the train station (Sounder at tacoma or airport) to go downtown....but do not advise to take a car to the train station in Tacoma as the parking lot was extremely full all the time. the pool was very small and hot tub also was small, but ok. Business center had 2 computers, which were used most of the time, so if you wanted one, I had to use it off hours such as later at night. View was beautiful, could see Mt Renier from one side of the hotel. There's a bike trail next to the hotel if you have a bike. We didn't use the restarant, it was closed in the evening (as well as much of the other establishments in the area).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: bonzie78
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of booking a hotel for our extended family (22 people in total). It was a lovely hotel with a great breakfast, which is why we chose it, along with being close to the airport. The down side was...an hour and a half wait for supper even though the restaurant wasn't busy. When you have 8 children in the group this is not acceptable. Then the typical $4 bottle of water in the room, etc. and the kicker was you had a pay for LOCAL calls. Really??? I would rather pay a very expensive roaming charge and use my cell phone, just out of principle, than pay for a local call. My brother was ready to blow a fuse - in his eyes it was an awful place and he'd rather stay at the Best Western. I think next time I'll pass on the organizing LOL

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jimary81
Reviews.Content: For a full breakfast and a happy hour it helps save you money. Rooms were cleaned well. Has an adequate fitness area. A hidden gem is a walking/jogging/biking trail behind the hotel. Only downside I found was paying $10 a day for parking. I never like paying for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssb44
Reviews.Content: Good location, right next to Southcenter shopping mall, nice big rooms, good resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for the SEATAC area”
Reviews.Author: Vta_dude
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Best Western across the street for one night, we opted to look for nicer lodging. My wife got an excellent rate here so we gave it a try. The location is great for getting to and from the airport and is also very near shopping and several dining choices. The hotel is also about 12 minutes away from downtown Seattle. The rooms are clean and roomy, the staff seemed very nice and helpful. The business center was very convenient as I needed to print some tickets for a ball game. The breakfast is very good as well. The only negatives I can find are they charge for wi-fi and there is quite a bit of train traffic behind the hotel, so if you have a room on the back of the building ( like we did) there is some noise from the trains. And really, $10 for wi-fi, Boooo! We stayed in cheaper hotels that provide it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to SEA-TAC, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: nylady21
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, close to 11:00, so we missed the Manager's Reception, and we left early but the breakfast opened promptly at 6:00 am so we got to enjoy one of the best Embassy Suites breakfasts we've had. Omelets were great, with fresh produce. Fresh fruit was high quality. Coffee was delicious. The beds were comfortable. Although we had made a reservation for 4 people, there were only 3 sets of towels. I used hand towels which was really annoying. I expect that the staff would have brought more towels but I didn't want to stay awake after discovering the short supply. The bathroom sink drained incredibly slowly but worked. The airport shuttle driver was courteous and prompt. Generally, a positive stay but some room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Ayayitstiffany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to the airport and even has a free airport shuttle. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good enough to get our family started for the day. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Would stay here again for sure and is totally worth the money spent. :)

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it anymore”
Reviews.Author: yvrkids
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this hotel for years, as a stayover for flights leaving and returning to Seattle airport, and over the years, the facility has seemed in worse and worse shape. It is always something, now, be it the towel hook is falling off the bathroom door, the shower curtain bar is drooping, the toilet flush a little lame, or the hot water a little unpredictable. The staff have always been, and remain, fantastic, which is why we keep coming back. But I think it has reached the point now that we are going to look for somewhere else to lay over before and after flights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: CampFamily4
Reviews.Content: While visiting Seattle to see a Mariners game we needed a comfortable and clean place to stay. Embassy Suites was it! We enjoyed Shirley Temples and chips at the social hour, swam in the pool, and the following morning had a full complimentary breakfast. We especially appreciated the refrigerator and microwave in our suite, as well as the coffee/tea making equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great service and a very nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: barbarapitts
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The staff was great, and the rooms were fine. Great breakfast and happy hour. The shuttle to the airport runs every half hour and was always on time. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it used to be..........”
Reviews.Author: Avlem
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at an Embassy Suites before flying on to our destination. We have done this for years and have enjoyed having a suite and the nice complimentary breakfast that is offered. However, recently their rates seem to be too high and they seem to be hosting a lot of conventions - with large numbers of children and/or young adults who appear to have never stayed in a hotel before - they are constantly riding the elevators and running around the halls that overlook the atrium. As a result we are actively looking for other places to stay. The restaurant that is in the hotel is generally quite good and saves having to go out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: C17Loadie
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the Internet, not even free in the lobby. Luckily, I had a room overlooking the Courtyard Marriott next door, who offer free Internet and have very good signal strength! The rooms themselves were awesome. Big and comfortable, great bed. Housekeeping did a great job. Prefer the breakfast buffet over the Embassy's line up, but it is a good trade off to get the cook to order eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but flunked "clean and everything works as it should" test”
Reviews.Author: 6530bx4
Reviews.Content: There are many things to like about this hotel and a family with young kids looking for a weekend base camp with a free breakfast may enjoy the place. It cetainly wasn't terrible but a business traveler might think twice, especially if paying full rate. There was a nice desk in my room and another smaller vanity in the bedroom. The front room smelled a little of smoke. The beds were terribly soft. I woke up with a bad bachache. Thermostat was hit and miss for controlling a/c and heat. VERY HARSH fluorescent lighting (which is strange given that soft white fluorescent lights bulbs cost the same). Toliet seat broken. Soap dish coming off in the shower. Wi-Fi is expensively extra -- $10/day. Parking is tough -- you could actually park at the Courtyard next door and be closer to the door. Breakfast was chaotic -- they need to have someone there just to guide people. This is not to say that the Embassy Suites is a horror chamber -- it isn't but there needs to be more attenton to things and a competitive spirit (everyone else is free WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience as expected”
Reviews.Author: butteguy
Reviews.Content: As expected with Embassy Suites, my experiance at SEATAC was excellent. Room was clean, updated, comfortable. Nightly reception was as expected and appreciated. Morning breakfast had excellent selection for anyone. Restaurant was quite good. Shuttle to airport was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: c_bound
Reviews.Content: Our family came together here for a cruise to Alaska. There were 28 of us and we came in from early Thursday to late Friday night. We held a family meeting and spent a lot of time in the common areas. The staff was very accomodating. Everyone from the bartender to the hotel clerks were cheerful and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a Free Reception!”
Reviews.Author: RockyRacoon058
Reviews.Content: We were quickly checked in and found the staff to be helpful in directing us to restaurants within walking distance. The room was pretty nice, but the sofa was in desperate need of new upholstery or replacement. Food at their restaurant is quite high in price, but the menu selection was nice. The free evening reception consists of popcorn, salsa and chips for food. The drinks are not to be taken lightly; they actually serve hard liquor and don't hold back on the pour either. Samuel Adams is also served on tap. My husband was very impressed and happy with this. Most evening receptions are beer and cheap wine only. The free breakfast was also fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip3r
Reviews.Content: Had a conferenc at this hotel and was very concerned when checking in with the amount of children and could only imagine the noise. The rooms were much quieter than I had thought. The "managers happy hour" sincerely needed more than one bartender working it - I guess they never have to worry about anyone haveing more than one, you could never make through the line to get your second! Lines for breakfast just as bad. It is not free when you pay a premium at a specail conference rate the "extras" are really not so free. On a good note the catering staff did an excellent job our conference ran smooth and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: ValleyMom84
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about staying at this hotel after reading some less-than-positive reviews avbout it online, but we ended up taking a wrong turn from the airport and ended up away from the Holiday Inn Express. It was 11pm, and we were exhausted, so we decided to take our chances. We needed a room big enough for us and our three children so Embassy Suites are a good fit for us. Our room looked like it had recently been remodeled. It was very clean, and modern, with new bedding with the triple-sheeting like Holiday Inn Express does, and all of us loved it. There was a table that could be pulled out from the wall that all of us could sit at and eat our fast-food meal we brought with us. We did not have to pay for parking, as someone else posted. Our college daughter had a paper due that she had to turn in, so she went and used the business center downstairs and got her work submitted. The next day the front desk person gave us an easy-to-follow map that had directions to IKEA and the mall on it, so we were off! We were very glad we took our chances on this hotel-we were not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: ZLCATC
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I am in the Seattle area for business. The staff here are great and always friendly! The rooms are super quiet and dark, great for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Below average for Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: A_Michigan_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is showing signs of wear on carpets and furniture. The beds weren't very comfortable. There is an $8/day charge for self-parking yet this is clearly a suburban hotel with lots of open space around it. Typically parking is included in the price in such locations. Wifi is available for an extra charge - not free. Billed as an airport hotel yet it is about a 10 minute drive from the airport. There is an extra charge of $15/day per adult over 1 in the room (to cover the allegedly "free" breakfast). The breakfast is a little lower quality than what I've seen at other Embassy Suites (no English Muffins available, fruit is cut melon and apples/oranges - no bananas or berries available; cereal selection is limited). Microwave/mini-fridge in room. Computers (2) in the business center sketchy - one not connected to the printer. Clearly this property is being milked for all possible profit at the expense of the customer experience. Would recommend only to those who realize that they will be receiving an abbreviated Embassy Suites experience. Sights to visit in Seattle (one day): Museum of flight (4 miles away from hotel); Harbor cruise (10 minutes from museum); Pike Place Market (walk from harbor cruise); Space needle (open at night too). The Elliott's Oyster House restaurant (next to harbor cruise dock) has an amazing selection of oysters on the half shell - highly recommended if you want oysters.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: razzbazz
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this particular hotel for over 20 years and have never been disappointed! We particularly like the spacious rooms, full breakfast and cocktail reception in the evening and the rate is generally so affordable (especially for a family of 5!) The rooms have all been remodeled and look great - we wont stay anywhere else when we visit Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: kaikoasurf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites and loved it! The staff there were professional and courteous. The pool was clean (however a little murky perhaps the pH was too high on it) and the jacuzzi was hot :)... As for the morning breakfast try to show up early if not be prepared to wait for a maximum of 5 minutes. As for the "Managers social gathering" the drinks were awesome and FREE! The pros: Free drinks plus an awesome restaurant/ bar...24/7 pool and awesome gym with free weights and WORKING tv's on the units. 2 tv's in the rooms, and 3 elevators so you dont have to wait for long. The Cons: Pool was murky.. snack bar was wayyy to overpriced, and internet still isnt free

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, lots of kids and sloooooowest internet”
Reviews.Author: Rickr7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good in this sense. 5-10 minutes from the hotel, it's and Embassy so the room is huge, the breakfast is great. If you need anything there are a ton of retail outlets and a Westfield mall right in the area. My saturday night stay was filled with a ton of kids roaming the hotel and parties in many rooms. Sunday after the extreamly large breakfast line started to open up space. By Sunday night and Monday morning the hotel was back to normal, very plesant after Sunday morning. My negative comments would come with $8 parking and an options for $9.95 or $14.95 Wi Fi. Take the $9.95 either way it is so slow. The resturant is not bad, not great but good price and will hit the spot. The room was very confortable> Overall it fit my needs very well. I would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Very large, clean rooms with full breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: konsdad
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here while attending a youth soccer tournament. (Seatac Cup.) After much research, we chose the Embassy Suites. I was very happy with the choice. The rooms are very clean and spacious with very dark curtains for a good night sleep. A major plus was the actuall bedroom with 2 beds and a seperate TV....nice for my son to unwind before bed while I was using the rest of the suite. AC worked fantastic, luckily for it was a scorcher that weekend. The staff was very friendly and were helful in giving directions to several local hotels. The only downfall was the pool. The pool and hot tub are very small and over chloriinated. Also not too impressed with smoking rooms mixed in with the non-smoking......get an occasional smell of cigs. when walking down open foyer to the elevator. Overall, very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Day Care Center”
Reviews.Author: Snogoer
Reviews.Content: Check In , Wait In Line To Cyring Kids In The Lobby Happy Hour,Cheap Booze Never Seen That Brand Before Stay , Kids On The Rampage In The Hallways And Pool Breakfast, Elbow Your Way Thru The Maze Of People For A Bagel (NO Thanks) Parking $8 It Appears They Now Are Also A Park & Ride , Looks Like Some Shady Folks Hanging Out Back In The Lot ,Tukwila Police Were Also Low Ridin Running Plates.. If You Need To Get Some Work Done Skip This Hotel

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: bhnow
Reviews.Content: The rate I was in my reservation was not honored and the rep. was not very nice about it. TV on the fitness equipment did not work. Breakfast was a mess -- dishes all over and not stocked. I checked out two days early.

Reviews.Title: “All Inclusive - Almost”
Reviews.Author: Profigast
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent: Close to the airport (they provide a fee shuttle), close to the Southcenter Mall, close to Boeing, even a commuter train station in the back yard. So be prepared to hear the trains go by day and night, if you have a room facing north. Large suite, full cooked-to order- breakfast, free drinks at the nightly manager´s reception, pool, sauna are still included, but the parking lot and the Wifi do not come free any more. Also prices are no more a bargain. But still a lot of real luxury compared to an old-fashioned 5 Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made reservations later to arrive and find out no rooms were available!!!”
Reviews.Author: misssari
Reviews.Content: Rude staff! They booked our reservations and later we showed up with our handicap son to find out they overbooked their hotel winch left us no rooms whatsoever. The staff was rude and unsympathetic they were at fault yet didn't even help my family find another hotel! Who books reservations and overbooks their hotels? I will never recommend this embassy suites the staff was rude and inconsiderate. Please beware of reservations booking at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy but okay value -- but beware of added charges”
Reviews.Author: OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel when we were planning a last-minute trip to Seattle on a weekend that coincided with a big Microsoft conference, and every hotel downtown and on the East Side seemed to be booked. We have a small child, so we like to have a suite, and have stayed in Embassy Suites around Seattle, but this was the first time in the SeaTac Embassy Suites. The good: Our room was very spacious, and seemed reasonably clean. There was a small kitchenette in the room with a microwave and a tiny sink that we could use to wash & sterilize bottles. The bad: Extra charges everywhere. Yes, at all Embassy Suites the wifi is extra (which is lame in this day and age, but not unexpected for a hotel in the Hilton chain). But here, the parking is $8/day, despite having to park yourself in a huge lot that's never full. They wanted $15/day extra for each extra person, including the baby. When I asked why, since this isn't the case at any other Embassy Suites I've ever visited, I was informed that it's to cover their "complimentary" breakfast. Uh, at most Embassy Suites the complimentary breakfast is covered in the cost of the room, not extra -- and I can find breakfast for a lot less than $15/person in Seattle (and especially in Southcenter). And the baby eats my milk and sleeps in my Pack & Play on my sheet -- so why should I have to pay $15/day extra for her? Other bad things: No hot water in the kitchenette sink. In the end I had to move hot water to that sink using glasses and the bathroom sink (no one wants to wash bottles in a bathroom, or cold water). The TV doesn't get all the local channels -- if you want to watch, say, the Mariners game on that night, you can't, because the hotel doesn't get FSN. Also, be warned: SeaTac (more accurately for this hotel, Southcenter) is a sketchy area. There have been shootings at the mall, etc. You get a VERY mixed crowd at this hotel -- airport travellers who didn't realize this hotel was nowhere near the airport mixed with heavily tattooed construction workers. If the room could have been moved into a normal Embassy Suites, in a better area of town, this would have been a great value. As it is, though, I would only recommend it with reservations. If I have to stay at the airport, I'll stay at a nicer hotel close by the airport, not this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great location 10 minutes from Seattle. But no free WiFi.”
Reviews.Author: Escape-Is-At-Hand
Reviews.Content: I always stay in Tukwila/Southcenter when I visit Seattle, and usually stay at the Embassy. Staff are always great, including breakfast and reception servers. The cooked to order breakfast is great, and so is "happy hour" at the managers reception. Rooms are large two-room suites, very comfortable and clean. The location is 10 minutes from Seattle, 20 minutes from Tacoma, and only a short distance from Southcenter mall, and Renton is just on the other side of the 405 freeway. My only complaint is that the last time I stayed I was in a room on the South side of the building directly over the loading area, and was awoken at 5:00AM by delivery trucks backing into the loading bay, then another night by garbage trucks picking up dumpsters. Also the room was non-smoking, but had a strong cigarette smoke smell when I arrived which cleared up after a day. So I think the previous guest was smoking in the bathroom. Finally, when will hotels learn that it's time to stop delivering useless USA Today newspapers, and start giving customers free Wireless Internet instead? People are getting their news and email from their iPhones, iPads, Laptops etc. It's time to make this a feature, instead of an expensive $14.99 item. Or even make it available free for Rewards members. But stop screwing your customers with expensive fees, or forcing them to find the nearest Starbucks to check their mail. All things considered, next time I'll stay at the Hampton Inn which is right next door and has free WiFi and is a half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and inexperienced front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: sananelan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a family with two kids. The front desk staff is very rude and inexperienced. Half of the service staff do not speak english. The place looks feels like a cheap budget hotel run on a very stringent budget. Even though the hotel's web page indicated that pets were allowed with no mention of cost. The front desk staff automatically charged us an extra $75.00 fee without even asking us, and did not even want to listen to our explanation. I would not stay at this property again or any other Embassy Suites. I learned my lesson

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, staff and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: chi2tan
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights and the service and staff was awesome. We had a 2-room suite with King bed in the bedroom and pullout in the living area. Management and staff were exceptional and the entire place was clean and pleasant. Even my 12-yr-old daughter commented on how clean the place was. Our stay came with daily hot breakfast and openbar manager's reception in the PM. Although the place was packed with teenage girls for the volleyball tournament, nothing ever got out of hand. One thing that would have made stay better was a better bed in the pull-out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service but be aware of added charges”
Reviews.Author: SuperShopper2
Reviews.Content: Our family spent New Year's Eve/day in Seattle. The staff at Embassy suites were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and a good size for the family. The beds are double beds not Queen-sized. Was a bit snug for 2 adults sharing. Breakfast was good - lots of selection - would opt for the "Made to Order" line vs the Express Line if possible - the eggs in the warming tray were not the best. Also, bit surprised that there were no muffins/danish available but lots of other items to choose from. Was under the impression from their webpage that Wi-Fi access in the rooms was free. It is available but must pay $10/night for this. My husband had his laptop and the kids had I-pods that they couldn't use in the room without paying the extra fee. The hotel does have a business center with internet/printer which I did use but it's not the same as having the service in your room. I think the way they advertise internet access is a bit deceiving - it should state that there is a fee. Also note that you have to pay extra for parking. Again, most of the other hotels in the area do not charge for this. All in all, it was a pleasant experience and we would stay here again although I think the Residence Inn and Homewoods Suites might be a better deal. (They were both full on the dates we needed)

Reviews.Title: “Always a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: imadurl
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Embassy Suites because it is generally a good value with the evening reception and made to order breakfasts. I pre-paid for our room and we arrived at the hotel just after midnight. Check in was fast and flawless and we received a room on the third floor. We were exhausted and found the room to be spacious and clean, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Just as we were falling asleep we heard a train whistle and my husband hoped that would be the last one for the night. Unfortunately we heard the train whistle a few times throughout the night. When we went to breakfast in the morning, we had to wait awhile for the elevator and the middle one came - there was something wrong with it and it stopped extra long at every floor (thankfully we were only on the 3rd floor). Every time we had to use the elevator, only the middle one came. At breakfast, I ordered an omlette. As the chef had to work so fast, the vegetables inside were not cooked completely and were lukewarm. I was unimpressed with the bread selections and had a hard time figuring out how to find the toaster (which was behind the counter). There was a business center on the second floor and we were able to print out our flight boarding passes with no trouble. We did have to pay $8 for parking - which is the first time we have ever paid for parking at Embassy Hotel. However, we will stay at an Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient but hidden charges make it spendy”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTrioOregon
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to go to a Seahawks game. The hotel itself is mostly quiet. My only complaint is that others guests lets thier children run around the multiple floors and elevators playing tag and this went on quite late. We had a corner room and didn't hear the clatter and screching unless we were in the front room. The other noise came from road resurfacing that we COULD hear in the bedroom, this however was NOT the hotel's fault. The breakfast is decent. Internet access charges, PARKING fee, and TV/movie fees make the hidden charges mount up fast. All in all this is a good place to stay with friendly staff and VERY close to the starting station of Seattle's light rail. The hotel's shuttle will even take you there free. Lots of shopping close by if you desire.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for families.”
Reviews.Author: erinpdx38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with our 2 kids (ages 7 and 9). Our room was very clean and spacious. Very nice to have a separate room for the kids to sleep in. The managers reception was great- the kids had Shirley Temples and we had some cocktails. We ordered pizza from a local place and the front desk staff gave us a bunch of coupons to choose from which was very nice. The breakfast the next morning was very good- lots of choices. My only complaint is that there were no luggage carts when we arrived. Also, the $8 fee for parking seems silly. We have stayed here in the past and there was no parking fee. The staff held our luggage for us the next day after we checked out while we went to the Mariners game. This was very helpful since we didn't want to leave all of it unattended for several hours in our car. We would definitely stay here again. If you are willing to pay in advance, the on-line rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying here!”
Reviews.Author: MGD220
Reviews.Content: We booked reservations at this hotel directly through the hotel's website several weeks in advance. When we arrived, we were told by the front desk staff that despite the reservation with confirmation number in our hand, that they had no room for us because their manager had told them to overbook the property. Apparently having a reservation is meaningless at this property. They did put us in a neighboring property, but the quality was substantially less than the Embassy. I will never book reservations with this chain again. I would strongly advise others to assume that your reservation is worthlessless, because ours certainly was.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is at the top of my list in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: urmpha
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! It was clean, quiet, and an exceptional value! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of parking fees and awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: btreid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now charging parking fees. My husband and I couldn't believe it. Why do you need to charge your customers parking fees? The mall is just around the corner and Courtyard and Best Western doesn't even charge even a single dime. I think they really don't want old clients like us to stay. We've been staying here for over a decade and suddenly they decided to charge parking fees. Too many mediocre breakfast choices and lousy coffee. Have you tried the manager's reception offerings? Please don't even try it. We were there and couldn't believe what they have, FROZEN carrots and celery and cheap popcorn. Gone are the days that they used to offer us chips, nachos, salsa, popcorn, veggie platter , pretzels, drinks etc. I think Embassy Suites should stop giving breakfast to their customers and cut the hotel rate and get rid of their parking fees. By the way, they don't have Disney and Nickelodeon channels anymore , our kids were disappointed because for them when they go on vacation they get to watch Disney channel. We don't have cable channel and staying in a big hotel is such a treat for them because of Disney channel. No , we are not coming back to this hotel. Sorry, they failed us in many ways.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: dfitz0321
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Embassy Suites for $100 near the airport. Would not recommend it. Originally, we didn't plan to ck in til late (around 11pm after riding train back from Vanc), so basically just needed a clean, quiet place to sleep that was close to airport for early flight. But our plans changed and we got back to Seattle early. Embassy would have been fine for our original plans for just a place to sleep, but arriving early, by cab w/o own car, there was nothing nearby, the pool was indoor and packed with young kids, the jacuzzi had foam floating on top that was a good 12 inches thick (I believe this is due to impoper filtration and excessive body oils- yucky), the exercise room was a couple treamills, and a couple other things, but kids were playing on them, so we didn't use the pool/gym area. The pool room had adult hours, but not til 10pm. Internet was only available at an addtl $15 charge, and the business room with 2 computers was cramped and set up so people could watch over your shoulder, I had to wait for a turn in order to do on-line ck in and print out our air boarding passes. The free cook to order breakfast isn't served til 7am on weekends, so with our 7:30am flight we had to leave w/o breakfast. The free airport shuttle was good and the beds were comfortable but small, the rooms felt dark and dingy because the front window looked into an enclosed courtyard type area (which gets very loud during happy hour), the bedroom window looked out at the Mariott Courtyard. I guess if you had your own car to go elsewhere for entertainment, and were staying a while w/ a need for the kitchenette, for the price this might be worth it, but not for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast and Happy Hour -- How Can You Lose at Embassy Suites?!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieG110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sea-Tac Embassy Suites (which is actually in Tukwila) for a week between Christmas and New Years (personal business), and would recommend it to any traveler needing a simple, cost efffective and comfortable home base while staying in the Seattle area. This is not the Ritz Carlton, but I really appreciated alot of the little details that abounded the property. The open air atrium and sky light was perfect for Seattle, where the sun rarely shines (actually, the week I was there, it snowed and apparently there are no snow plows in Seattle. Slush city). The rooms were clean (though the cleaning staff seemed to pick and choose what they wanted to clean), free breakfast and a managers happy hour w/snacks were nice touches and well appreciated by the crowd (which included families and business travellers), and the gym had up to date equipment (which is not always the case even in a Ritz Carlton!). The staff was responsive to our needs. There is a gigantic mall about 5 minutes away, and more fast food restaurants than you will ever need. Oh, and the guys and gals who worked at Rings Restaurant deserve a shout out -- they serve good Washington State wine and a damn fine burger.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Clean! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: Seein'_the_world
Reviews.Content: Great property! Great room! Wonderful towels! We really appreciated the mini-fridge and microwave as we warmed up Thanksgiving leftovers. The cooked-to-order breakfast the next morning was delicious. The only downside the was the girls' soccer team who also stayed there and had entitlement issues and didn't like standing in line for breakfast -- not the management's fault. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay here on return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: u12mjw
Reviews.Content: This is not only a great hotel if you are travelling in and out of seatac but, as they are suites, its great if your also visiting seattle. Its 3 minutes from a massive shopping mall, 10 mins to downtown seattle and not far from the museum of flight which is brilliant. Rooms were clean and smart and we stayed in one of the renovated rooms which was loverly...room 405 i think. Staff varied from overly helpful to kinda grumpy but that didnt affect our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - good as always”
Reviews.Author: game4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night in Seattle and it worked out very well. The room was a typical Embassy Suites room, which always works out well for our family of four. We love the Happy Hour in the evening, and the breakfasts are always good with lots of delicious options for everyone. Breakfast was busy, but not too crowded. This Embassy Suites has a free shuttle that will not only pick you up from the airport and return, but also take you to any place within five miles of the hotel - for no charge. Since we were not scheduled to pick up our rental car untl the next day, this was great. Our room was not ready when we arrived, so we left our bags with the front desk and had the shuttle take us to the Mall. There is a beautiful large mall very near the hotel. We went and saw a movie, then gave the Embassy Suites a call and they came and got us. No problem, no long wait, no charge. After Happy Hour we decided to go 13 Coins for dinner, which is a wonderful 24 hour restaurant near the airport. Again, no problem. The shuttle driver took us there and then we called when we were ready to go back. Of course, we were sure to tip our driver who by the way was very friendly. We almost felt as though we had our own personal driver! I have no complaints concerning our stay and would be more than happy to stay here again. It was both relaxing and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mlrmom
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through the Jet Blue website and were very glad we did. We arrived at SeaTac late in the evening and wanted to just get a good night's sleep before driving to Bellingham the next morning. We found the shuttle easiliy. The driver was very friendly and careful (the shuttle itself was sure squeaky though). Having already made a reservation, check in was easy in the elegant lobby. The room (two queen beds in a bed room and a pull out sofa in the living room) easiliy accomodated our family of five. There was one standard bath and a microwave, coffeemaker and refrigerator. The linens were clean. The best part was the made to order breakfast. It was wonderful and my kids wanted to go back there the rest of the trip! Omelettes were made to order along with bacon, sausage, hashbrowns. On the "side" were juices, yogurt, hot beverages, cereal, fruit and breads. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, Front Desk Staff TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: jojobeanWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites hotel the night before a cruise. My wife had made dinner reservations in town for us at a very nice restaurant. Upon arrival (4 pm) the hotel check in staff (Jasmine) told us our room wasn't ready but that a similar room was ready. We took that room and requested she call a cab for us as we needed to run to the room, freshen up quickly in order to make our 5 pm reservation. After returning to the lobby in 15 mins. time, we asked whether she had called, she (JASMINE) assured us that she had. We waited out front for 20 additional min. and no cab. I went back in and asked her what cab line she called and she couldn't tell me. JASMINE NEVER CALLED THE CAB. Long story short, she said she would call again and we waited till 5 mins. past 5 and nothing. SHE DIDN'T CALL AGAIN. We ended up taking the shuttle to The Claim Jumper and had dinner there. Needless to say, we were very angry but the front staff could care less! WE WONT STAY THERE AGAIN. The room was dated, but okay. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: The one night stay at this hotel went on w/o any problems. We checked in early with a very friendly staff. Our room was clean and had plenty of room. The managers special at night was great which we spent the entire 2 hours at. The breakfast the next morning was awesome. We used their free shuttle to and from the airport. The price could have been a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Misdamina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites on our wedding night, as we flew out for our honeymoon at 5am. Our experience was wonderful! When we arrived at the hotel, the staff had upgraded us to a nicer room. When we got to our room we found a bottle of champagne, popcorn, a free movie certificate and a card (signed by the front desk staff) in our room. We were thrilled that they thought of us and made out wedding night that much more special. We went down to the lobby for happy hour, where we enjoyed a complementary glass of wine and beer and then had dinner at the hotel restaurant, Rings. The steak and lobster were great and the waitress was very friendly. Even our free shuttle to the airport was great, because of the friendly driver who made us feel comfortable even at the early hour. I can't say enough good things about our stay at the Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: coolhand18
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few good things about this hotel. It is so nice to have a suite with a separate sitting area. When the kids go to sleep you still have the option to stay up awhile. The nightly manager's reception is a wonderful way to start the evening. And the made to order breakfast is second to none. I was blown away by the offerings at breakfast, ie omlettes, bacon, sausage, eggs, pancakes, and much more. Only one criticism would be that they could upgrade the facilities. They also have a problem with beatles. I understand that they fly in through the windows. Still, kinda yucky. I would still absolutely recommend this to any families for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: IdahoCoug
Reviews.Content: Pretty typical Embassy Suites, we actually stayed in their two bedroom which was nice. Had a larger more comfortable living area with larger TV. I also like the breakfast at this location more than other Embassy Suites I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy suites exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: LacrosseMom9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy suites with our field lacrosse team for a tournament at the Starfire sports complex. The location was excellent, a few blocks to the fields, shopping, restaurants and a Costco. The accomidations were great, perfect for families. Clean, spacious and well equiped.Despite the open atrium design the bedrooms were quiet. The hotel was fully booked with lacrosse teams and management was on top of keeping all the kids in line and ensuring a comfortable stay for all their guests. What impressed us all was what was included in our room rate. ( Team members recieved a tournament rate of $109 per night). This included a full "cooked to order" breakfast - omlettes, scrambled eggs,pancakes, french toast, bacon, sausage, muffins, cereal, oatmeal etc. and a nightly "managers reception" with complementary beverages - alcoholic and non, for TWO HOURS ! Afterwards we were welcome to remain in the atrium and mingle with the other guests and teams which was great, sure beat cramming into each others rooms to visit, as often happens at tournaments. The open concept allowed parents to monitor their children, while still able to socialize themselves. It was great ! We are hoping to return next year and will definately look for more Embassy suites when traveling anywhere else in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Seattle - Tacoma International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 15920 West Valley Hwy., Seattle, WA 98188
